Items.name: Big Root
Items.desc: HP stealing moves restore double HP. Cannot be used by Trainers.

Items.name: Bright Powder
Items.desc: +2 to Speed Evasion. Cannot be used by Trainers.

Items.name: Contest Accessory
Items.desc: The user rolls +2d6 during the Introduction Stage of a Contest. Cannot be used by Trainers.

Items.name: Yellow Scarf
Items.desc: When held, once per Contest, the holder may re-roll any 1s made when using a Tough Move. Cannot be used by Trainers.

Items.name: Red Scarf
Items.desc: When held, once per Contest, the holder may re-roll any 1s made when using a Cool Move. Cannot be used by Trainers.

Items.name: Pink Scarf
Items.desc: When held, once per Contest, the holder may re-roll any 1s made when using a Cute Move. Cannot be used by Trainers.

Items.name: Green Scarf
Items.desc: When held, once per Contest, the holder may re-roll any 1s made when using a Smart Move. Cannot be used by Trainers.

Items.name: Blue Scarf
Items.desc: When held, once per Contest, the holder may re-roll any 1s made when using a Beauty Move. Cannot be used by Trainers.

Items.name: Everstone
Items.desc: Evolution is prevented for the holder. Cannot be used by Trainers.

Items.name: Go-Goggles
Items.desc: The user does not take damage from Sandstorm. Head Item for Trainers.

Items.name: Iron Ball
Items.desc: The Holder's Speed is halved, and any immunity to Ground Type is lost. Hand Item for Trainers. Standard Action to drop.

Items.name: Lagging Tail
Items.desc: The Lagging Items are tied to a specific Stat. When held, they set that Stat to -4 Combat Stages. Cannot be used by Trainers. Standard Action to drop.

Items.name: Safety Goggles
Items.desc: The holder is immune to Moves with the Powder Keyword. Accessory or Head Item for Trainers.

Items.name: Black Belt

Items.name: Metal Coat

Items.name: Miracle Seed
Items.desc: When held, it grants a +5 Damage Bonus to all direct damage Grass-Type Moves performed by the user. Accessory Item for Trainers.

Items.name: Mystic Water

Items.name: Silver Powder
Items.desc: When held, it grants a +5 Damage Bonus to all direct damage Bug-Type Moves performed by the user. Accessory Item for Trainers.

Items.name: Soft Sand

Items.desc: Lowers the user's HP Base Stat 1.

Items.desc: Lowers the user's Attack Base Stat 1.

Items.desc: Lowers the user's Defense Base Stat 1.

Items.name: Blue Shard
Items.desc: A bit of colored energized crystal used for various crafting purposes. Blue Shards are associated with Water, Ice, and Flying types.

Items.name: Green Shard
Items.desc: A bit of colored energized crystal used for various crafting purposes. Green Shards are associated with Bug, Grass, and Ground types.

Items.name: Red Shard
Items.desc: A bit of colored energized crystal used for various crafting purposes. Red Shards are associated with Fire, Fairy, and Psychic types.

Items.name: Yellow Shard
Items.desc: A bit of colored energized crystal used for various crafting purposes. Yellow Shards are associated with Electric, Rock, and Steel types.

Items.name: Orange Shard
Items.desc: A bit of colored energized crystal used for various crafting purposes. Orange Shards are associated with Normal, Fighting, and Dragon types.

Items.name: Violet Shard
Items.desc: A bit of colored energized crystal used for various crafting purposes. Violet Shards are associated with Poison, Dark, and Ghost types.

Items.name: Honey

Items.name: Leftovers

Items.name: Black Sludge
Items.desc: Poison-Type Pokemon may consume the Black Sludge as a Snack Item; when the Digestion Buff is traded in, they recover 1/8th of their Max Hit Points at the beginning of each turn for the rest of the encounter.

Items.name: Energy Powder
Items.desc: Heals 25 Hit Points - Repulsive

Items.desc: Cure all Persistent Status Afflictions - Repulsive

Items.name: Choice Band
Items.desc: While worn, Attack is +2 Combat Stages instead of 0. However, the user is Suppressed and cannot be cured until the end of Combat, even if the item is removed. Cannot be used by Trainers.

Items.name: Choice Specs
Items.desc: While worn, Special Attack is +2 Combat Stages instead of 0. However, the user is Suppressed and cannot be cured until the end of Combat, even if the item is removed. Cannot be used by Trainers.

Items.name: Choice Scarf
Items.desc: While worn, Speed is +2 Combat Stages instead of 0. However, the user is Suppressed and cannot be cured until the end of Combat, even if the item is removed. Cannot be used by Trainers.

Items.name: Expert Belt
Items.desc: Whenever the holder deals Super Effective Damage, they deal an additional 5 damage (this damage is not multiplied). Accessory Item for Trainers.

Items.name: Flame Orb
Items.desc: Induces burn on holder. Off-Hand Item for Trainers. Standard Action to drop.

Items.name: King's Rock
Items.desc: Attacks cause Flinch on a roll of 19+. This does not stack with any abilities, moves, or effects that extend flinch rate. Head Item for Trainers. Can be used by Slowpoke and Poliwhirl to evolve.

Items.name: Full Incense
Items.desc: The holder gains the Stall ability. Cannot be used by Trainers. Causes Snorlax to be able to produce a Munchlax Egg

Items.name: Luck Incense
Items.desc: When held, it grants +1 Bonus to all Accuracy Rolls. A roll of 1 always misses. Cannot be used by Trainers. Causes Chansey and Blissey to be able to produce a Happiny Egg

Items.name: Lax Incense
Items.desc: When held, it grants +1 to all Stat Evasions. Cannot be used by Trainers. Causes Wobbuffet to be able to produce a Wynaut Egg

Items.name: Odd Incense
Items.desc: When held, it grants +2 to the Damage Base of Psychic-Type Move. Cannot be used by Trainers. Causes Mr. Mime to be able to produce a Mime Jr. Egg

Items.name: Pure Incense
Items.desc: When held, The user cannot be Slowed, Stuck, or Trapped.The user does not provoke Attacks of Opportunity by Shifting. Cannot be used by Trainers. Causes Chimecho to be able to produce a Chingling Egg

Items.name: Rock Incense
Items.desc: When held, it grants +2 to the Damage Base of Rock-Type Moves. Cannot be used by Trainers. Causes SudoWoodo to be able to produce a Bonsly Egg

Items.name: Rose Incense
Items.desc: When held, it grants +2 to the Damage Base of Grass-Type Moves. Cannot be used by Trainers. Causes Roselia and Roserade to be able to produce a Budew Egg

Items.name: Sea Incense
Items.desc: When held, it grants +2 to the Damage Base of Water-Type Moves. Cannot be used by Trainers. Causes Maril and Azumaril to be able to produce a Azurill Egg

Items.name: Wave Incense
Items.desc: When held, it grants +2 to the Damage Base of Water-Type Moves. Cannot be used by Trainers. Causes Mantine to be able to produce a Mantyke Egg

Items.name: Life Orb
Items.desc: Whenever the holder deals direct damage, increase the damage by +5, and then the holder loses Hit Points equal to 1/16th of their Max Hit Points. Off-Hand Item for Trainers.

Items.name: Razor Claw
Items.desc: The holder's damaging attacks have their Critical Hit Range extended by +1. Can be used by Sneasel to evolve.

Items.name: Razor Fang
Items.desc: The holder's damaging attacks cause an Injury on a roll of 19+. Accessory Item for Trainers. Can be used by Gilgar to evolve.

Items.desc: When held, it grants the holder 15 Damage Reduction against Rock-Type Moves. Accessory Item for Trainers.

Items.desc: When held, it grants the holder 15 Damage Reduction against Poison-Type Moves. Accessory Item for Trainers.

Items.name: Zap Brace

Items.name: Fist Brace

Items.name: Fire Stone
Items.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokemon evolve. The stone has a fiery orange heart.

Items.name: Water Stone
Items.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokemon evolve. It is the blue of a pool of clear water.

Items.name: Thunder Stone
Items.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokemon evolve. It has a distinct thunderbolt pattern.

Items.name: Leaf Stone
Items.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokemon evolve. It has an unmistakable leaf pattern.

Items.name: Moon Stone
Items.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokemon evolve. It is as black as the night sky.

Items.name: Sun Stone
Items.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokemon evolve. It burns as red as the evening sun.

Items.name: Shiny Stone
Items.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokemon evolve. It shines with a dazzling light.

Items.name: Dusk Stone
Items.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokemon evolve. It holds shadows as dark as can be.

Items.name: Dawn Stone
Items.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokemon evolve. It sparkles like a glittering eye.

Items.name: Deep Sea Scale
Items.desc: An item to be held by Clamperl. This scale shines with a faint pink and raises the holder's Sp. Def stat.

Items.name: Deep Sea Tooth
Items.desc: An item to be held by Clamperl. This fang gleams a sharp silver and raises the holder's Sp. Atk stat.

Items.name: Dragon Scale
Items.desc: Boosts the power of Dragon-type moves by 10% when held. Can be used by Seadra to evolve.

Items.name: Dubious Disc
Items.desc: A transparent device overflowing with dubious data. Its producer is unknown. Can be used by Porygon2 to evolve.

Items.name: Electirizer
Items.desc: A box packed with a tremendous amount of electric energy. It's loved by a certain Pokemon. Can be used by Electabuzz to evolve.

Items.name: Magmarizer
Items.desc: A box packed with a tremendous amount of magma energy. It's loved by a certain Pokemon. Can be used by Magmar to evolve.

Items.name: Prism Scale
Items.desc: A mysterious scale that causes Feebas to evolve. It shines in rainbow colors.

Items.name: Protector
Items.desc: A protective item of some sort. It is extremely stiff and heavy. It's loved by a certain Pokemon. Can be used by Rhydon to evolve.

Items.name: Reaper Cloth
Items.desc: A cloth imbued with horrifyingly strong spiritual energy. It's loved by a certain Pokemon. Can be used by Dusclops to evolve.

Items.name: Sachet
Items.desc: A sachet filled with fragrant perfumes that are just slightly too overwhelming. Yet it's loved by a certain Pokemon. Can be used by Spritzee to evolve.

Items.name: Up-Grade
Items.desc: A transparent device somehow filled with all sorts of data. It was produced by Silph Co. Can be used by Porygon to evolve.

Items.name: Whipped Dream
Items.desc: A soft and sweet treat made of fluffy, puffy, whipped and whirled cream. It's loved by a certain Pokemon. Can be used by Swirlix to evolve.

Items.name: Oval Stone
Items.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokemon evolve. It's as round as a Pokemon Egg. Can be used by Happiny to evolve.

Items.name: Heart Scale
Items.desc: This tiny rainbow scale from a Luvdisc is valued by Apothecary Researchers, because it can be used to create the Heart Booster vitamin.

Items.desc: Used to make a Level Ball

Items.desc: Used to make a Moon Ball

Items.desc: Used to make a Lure Ball

Items.desc: Used to make a Friend Ball

Items.desc: Heals 70 Hit Points - Repulsive

Items.desc: Revives Pokemon and sets to 50% Hit Points - Repulsive

Items.name: Mental Herb
Items.desc: Cures all Volatile Status Effects.

Items.name: Power Herb
Items.desc: Eliminates the Set-Up turn of Moves with the Set-Up Keyword.

Items.name: White Herb
Items.desc: Any negative Combat Stages are set to 0.

Items.name: Pearl
Items.desc: Can be sold for $1400.

Items.name: Stardust
Items.desc: Can be sold for $2000.

Items.name: Relic Copper
Items.desc: Can be sold for $1000.

Items.name: Relic Vase
Items.desc: The right person may want this.

Items.name: Relic Statue
Items.desc: The right person may want this.

Items.name: Relic Band
Items.desc: The right person may want this.

Items.name: Relic Crown
Items.desc: The right person may want this.

Items.name: Max Repel
Items.desc: Lasts 5 hour; causes Pokemon of level 35 or lower to flee.

Items.name: Great Ball
Items.desc: A better Poke Ball with no special effects.

Items.name: Level Ball
Items.desc: -20 Modifier if the target is under half the level your active Pokémon is.

Items.name: Lure Ball
Items.desc: -20 Modifier if the target was baited into the encounter with food.

Items.name: Moon Ball
Items.desc: -20 Modifier if the target evolves with an Evolution Stone.

Items.name: Friend Ball
Items.desc: A caught Pokémon will start with +1 Loyalty.

Items.name: Love Ball
Items.desc: -30 Modifier if the user has an active Pokémon that is of the same evolutionary line as the target, and the opposite gender.

Items.name: Heavy Ball
Items.desc: -5 Modifier for each Weight Class the target is above 1.

Items.name: Fast Ball
Items.desc: -20 Modifier if the target has a Movement Capability above 7.

Items.name: Repeat Ball
Items.desc: -20 Modifier if you already own a Pokemon of the target’s species.

Items.name: Timer Ball
Items.desc: -5 to the Modifier after every round since the beginning of the encounter, until the Modifier is -20.

Items.name: Nest Ball
Items.desc: .20 Modifier if the target is under level 10.

Items.name: Net Ball
Items.desc: -20 Modifier, if the target is Water or Bug type.

Items.name: Dive Ball
Items.desc: -20 Modifier, if the target was found underwater or underground.

Items.name: Luxury Ball
Items.desc: A caught Pokemon is easily pleased and starts with a raised happiness.

Items.name: Heal Ball
Items.desc: A caught Pokemon will heal to Max HP immediately upon capture.

Items.name: Quick Ball
Items.desc: +5 to Modifier after 1 round of the encounter, +10 to Modifier after round 2, +20 to modifier after round 3.

Items.name: Dusk Ball
Items.desc: -20 Modifier if it is dark, or if there is very little light out, when used.

Items.name: Fluffy Tail
Items.desc: A toy that attracts the attention of a Pokemon. It guarantees escape from any battle with wild Pokemon.

Items.name: Poke Toy
Items.desc: A toy that attracts the attention of a Pokemon. It guarantees escape from any battle with wild Pokemon.

Items.name: Poke Doll
Items.desc: A doll that attracts the attention of a Pokemon. It guarantees escape from any battle with wild Pokemon.

Items.name: Eviolite
Items.desc: Only affects not-fully-evolved Pokemon of a single family, decided when the Eviolite is made. Grants a +5 Bonus to two different Stats, after Combat Stages, decided when the Eviolite is made. Prevents Pokemon from evolving when held. Cannot be used by Trainers.

Items.name: Focus Band
Items.desc: Whenever the user faints, roll 1d20. Once a Scene on a result of 16+, the holder does not faint, and is left with 1 Hit Point. Accessory Item for Trainers.

Items.name: Focus Sash
Items.desc: Once a Scene, if damage from a Move would take Focus Sash's holder's Hit Points from Max to 0 or less, Focus Sash's holder instead has 1 Hit Point remaining. Accessory Item for Trainers.

Items.name: Quick Claw
Items.desc: The user adds +10 to their Initiative. Accessory Item for Trainers.

Items.name: Shell Bell
Items.desc: Whenever the user damages a foe, they gain a Tick of Temporary Hit Points. Accessory Item for Trainers.

Items.name: HP Booster
Items.desc: When held, the default Stage of HP is +1 Combat Stage instead of 0. Accessory Item for Trainers.

Items.name: Attack Booster
Items.desc: When held, the default Stage of Attack is +1 Combat Stage instead of 0. Accessory Item for Trainers.

Items.name: Defense Booster
Items.desc: When held, the default Stage of Defense is +1 Combat Stage instead of 0. Accessory Item for Trainers.

Items.name: Special Attack Booster
Items.desc: When held, the default Stage of Special Attack +1 Combat Stage instead of 0. Accessory Item for Trainers.

Items.name: Special Defense Booster
Items.desc: When held, the default Stage of Special Defense +1 Combat Stage instead of 0. Accessory Item for Trainers.

Items.name: Speed Booster
Items.desc: When held, the default Stage of Speed +1 Combat Stage instead of 0. Accessory Item for Trainers.

Items.name: Accuracy Booster
Items.desc: When held, it gives +1 for Accuracy and Evasion. Accessory Item for Trainers.

Items.name: Toxic Orb
Items.desc: Induces Poison on holder. Off-Hand Item for Trainers. Standard Action to drop.

Items.name: Bug Gem
Items.desc: When held, it can be consumed as a Free Action to give a +3 Damage Base bonus to one attack of the Bug-Type. Off-hand or Accessory Slot Item for Trainers

Items.name: Dark Gem
Items.desc: When held, it can be consumed as a Free Action to give a +3 Damage Base bonus to one attack of the Dark-Type. Off-hand or Accessory Slot Item for Trainers

Items.name: Metal Powder
Items.desc: When held by an untransformed Ditto, increases both Defense and Special Defense by +2 Combat Stages. Cannot be used by Trainers.

Items.name: Rare Leek
Items.desc: When held by a Farfetch'd, this rare Leek increase the holder's critical range by 2. Rare Leeks are Wielded. Cannot be used by Trainers.

Items.name: Thick Club
Items.desc: When held by a Cubone or Marowak, this rare, dense bone grants the Pure Power Ability. Thick Clubs are Wielded. Cannot be used by Trainers.

Items.name: Pink Pearl
Items.desc: Acts as a Psychic Type Booster. If held by a Spoink, it also acts as a Special Attack Stat Booster.

Items.name: HP Up
Items.desc: Raise the user's HP Base Stat 1.

Items.name: Protein
Items.desc: Raise the user's Attack Base Stat 1.

Items.name: Iron
Items.desc: Raise the user's Defense Base Stat 1.

Items.name: Calcium
Items.desc: Raise the user's Special Attack Base Stat 1.

Items.name: Zinc
Items.desc: Raise the user's Special Defense Base Stat 1.

Items.name: Carbos
Items.desc: Raise the user's Speed Base Stat 1.

Items.name: Heart Booster
Items.desc: The Pokemon gains 2 Tutor Points. Use only one per Pokemon.

Items.name: PP Up
Items.desc: Raise one of the user's Move's Frequency one level. Use only one per Pokemon.

Items.name: Tiny Mushroom
Items.desc: The user loses 5 HP, and gains +1 Combat Stage in a random Stat.

Items.name: Big Mushroom
Items.desc: The user becomes Poisoned; if they do, they gain +1 Combat Stage in two random Stats.

Items.name: Balm Mushroom
Items.desc: The user is cured of Burn, Paralysis, or Poison. If they are, they lose 1 Combat Stage in a random Stat.

Items.desc: Grants the Priority keyword to any Move. May only be used at 25% HP or lower

Items.name: Rare Candy
Items.desc: These very rare treats, When ingested by a Pokemon, grant the eater enough experience to reach its next Level. Pokemon may benefit from up to five Rare Candies in their lifetime.

Items.name: Pearl String
Items.desc: Can be sold for $25000.

Items.name: Big Nugget
Items.desc: Can be sold for $30000.

Items.name: Comet Shard
Items.desc: Can be sold for $60000.

Items.name: Egg Warmer
Items.desc: Egg Warmers are insulated cases that carry up to four Pokémon Eggs and protect them from harm. They also cause Pokémon to hatch twice as fast; each day spent in an Egg Warmer counts as 2 days for the purposes of Hatch Rate.

Items.name: Groomer's Kit
Items.desc: Used by Trainers with the Groomer Edge to clean their Pokémon.

Items.name: Chemistry Set
Items.desc: Used to create Repels, Potions, and other objects.

Items.name: Cooking Set
Items.desc: Used by Chefs to create Snacks and Refreshments

Items.name: Dowsing Rod
Items.desc:
Dowsing Rods have been attuned to the energy resonance given off by Shards. They may be used while in any route, cave, or outside area. They may be activated by spending 10 minutes searching an area, and may be activated a number of times per day equal to half of the trainer’s Occult Education Rank.
After the 10 minutes, roll 1d6 per Occult Education Rank. If the area being searched is a beach, cave, desert, or any other sandy or rocky area, roll +1d6. If you have Skill Stunt (Dowsing), you roll an additional 1d6. For each die that results in 4 or higher, you find 1 Shard of a random color: Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, or Violet. You may reroll any die that result in 6, gaining that shard and potentially more.

Items.name: Poffin Mixer
Items.desc: A Poffin Mixer can be used by any Trainer to create Poffins. You simply insert cooking ingredients worth $500, and at least one of the listed berries. You create two Poffins that raises the Contest Stat most represented by the berries used by +1 Contest Die. Some Berries can raise multiple Contest Stats; you choose which to raise when using these Berries to make Poffins. Cheri, Figy, Razz, Spelon and Belue Berries raise Cool; Chesto, Wiki, Bluk, Spelon and Pamtre Berries raise Beauty; Pecha, Mago, Nanab, Pamtre, and Watmel Berries raise Cute; Rawst, Aguav, Wepear, Watmel, and Durin Berries raise Smart; Aspear, Iapapa, Pinap, Durin, and Belue Berries raise Tough.

Items.name: Poffin Case
Items.desc: A handy case for storing poffins for quick retrieval.

Items.name: Poke Ball Tool Box
Items.desc: These tool boxes let those with the know-how craft and repair Poke Balls.

Items.name: Portable Growers
Items.desc: Portable Growers can be used to grow berries and herbs. Portable Growers protect the plants within them from external weather, and never need to be fertilized. Each Grower holds one plant.

Items.name: Scrap (Food)
Items.desc: Scarp is material that can be used in place of money when crafting. Give a value to this that makes sense for the area/story.

Items.name: Mega Ring
Items.desc: Mega Rings are extraordinarily rare accessories that allow a Trainer’s Pokémon to Mega Evolve when used in conjunction with a Mega Stone. They cannot be bought in stores anywhere and must usually be earned through a trial of sorts, governed by a Gym Leader or other influential Pokémon Trainer. They can take the form of a bracelet, a necklace, or an actual ring.
